website_summaries.verdict: The Canon PowerShot SD990 IS is a fine ultracompact camera, but its price-to-feature benefits are questionable.
pros: very good shooting options for its size

customer_reviews.title: Best little point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: This is the best littl point and shoot camera I have ever used. I have two of the now. While it isn't an SLR, in some instances I have found the photos taken with this camera on par with my more expensive cameras. The only real limitation that I have to be mindful of is the limited distance that is useful using the flash. The in-built flash is good to a distance of about 8 feet or so.... After that the picture is progressively u dear exposed at further distance, but with a little help from Lightroom or Photoshop, you can yield good results a bit further.
customer_reviews.author: Occasional Spender

customer_reviews.title: Canon SD 990 IS- does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I've had the camera for a month and still need to use it in more varied conditions. So far I've mostly done inside snapshots, which came out great. I like the size and feel of the camera. The controls are easy to use and there are more manual setting options than the casual photographer needs most of the time. However, I'm looking forward to taking some landscapes and variable light shots to see how the camera works under those conditions. My last camera was a 5-yr old Canon Powershot SD 45. This camera is much better than that one. I think it is a good value for the price. Also, the black body looks really good!
customer_reviews.author: Ellis K.

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Camera takes excellent photos. It is small in size, but not too small. If you are looking for something to tuck into your pocket, this is not the one for you. But if you are looking for a good point and shoot with some manual control, this one is great. It has automatic setting for point and shoot, but you also have overrides to adjust shutter settings, or at least choose from other semi-automatic settings such as nightscapes and action shots. It comes with a mere 32 MB card, though - enough for about 6 pictures. Order extra memory cards when purchasing this one.
customer_reviews.author: L. Graham

customer_reviews.title: All U ever want in a point and shoot!!!
customer_reviews.text: The SD 990 is an amazing piece of work. It does everything from the most simple to the complex techniques in photography. I bought it for my girlfriend at first and after a few months of toying with it, i purchased my own. I couldn't be more happier. It is an amazing camera! The feel is great, the interface is user friendly, and most of all it makes any amateur take professional photos. the photos i get from this camera is amazing. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!
customer_reviews.author: Roman A. Sarmiento

customer_reviews.title: Best Compact Camera EVER
customer_reviews.text: Ok, my title might be going a bit overboard, but I can honestly say it's the best handheld/compact camera that I've ever owned (& I've owned a LOT over the years). It looks great, it's comfortable in your hand, & it takes amazing pictures! I'm sure some professional will say it's nothing compared to SLR cameras, & in many ways they're right. But, for something this small that fits into your coat pocket, it's a hard little camera to beat!
customer_reviews.author: Joey BTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great Small Camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera after having my SD870 destroyed. This camera is a good improvement to an already good camera. I have a SLR and have used this as an additional camera. It is handy to have and produces photos that are vibrant and rival the SLR. The only thing that I dislike is the price. But they do pack a lot into this small device. Did I mention that it also does video? Not just a few short clips, but full video. It does not replace a camcorder, but it gives you a lot of options. cbp
customer_reviews.author: Chris Parker

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera but a bit pricey
customer_reviews.text: Nice camera ... takes great photos. The wide angle leave a bit to be desired. It is hardly a wide angle. Other than that it is a nice compact camera. It takes nice crisp and sharp pictures. The camera gives you a lot of room to zoom in and crop a picture before printing it. I recommend the Canon Leather carrying case for it as well. It fits nice and snug in the hard case. I literally throw it in the bottom of my brief case and have no problems with it. Contrary to other reviews, my camera holds a nice charge!
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent small camera for everyone
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the SD700IS to the new SD990IS after reading all the specs and reviews. It exceeds all my expectations and offers significant improvements. The camera slips easily into my front pocket, always ready to capture those unexpected scenes. The new zoom range and macro capabilities are especially appreciated. I highly recommend this camera for everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Walker, Reviewer and Artist

customer_reviews.title: Way Fast
customer_reviews.text: After hours and hours and hours of surfing reviews, I finally chose this camera since I like the clarity of Canon cameras. I bought a SanDisk Ultra II SDHC 4GB card to go with it after reading reviews which claimed a 4GB is faster than 2GB and SanDisk is a great brand. This camera is so fast. From shot to shot, it is fast, compared with my older Canon. There is also a function where you can press the camera button and it will continuously shoot photos and that is supposed to be even faster. Clear and fast. That's what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Waxy

customer_reviews.title: Great item and great overall experience
customer_reviews.text: Described well and a great value for what I paid for this item!! Also very quick shipping and very accurate description. It was like brand new!!
customer_reviews.author: CBKCTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera for a great price
customer_reviews.text: What a purchase - great camera and easy to use. Buttons are very intuitive and takes great pictures and pretty good video as well. Get a 8GB SD card when you get it and you are all set. Transferring pictures from camera to computer is a breeze and the whole experience is well worth the cash layout. The reviews on this site helped me, as well as steve's digicams...but I buy all of my items on here! I looked at the sd870, 880, and 990 and for the price the 990 was it. i waited over a year to buy the 870 and switched to this and boy am I glad that I did.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Hagmann

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent camera. What you give up in areas like optical zoom is made up for by the speed of the camera and the quality of pictures it takes. TONS of features built in. Love the color swap feature - worked great in the Oregon mountains for capturing all the vivid greens. The camera even took a fall down the trail at Shepperd's Dell waterfall with hardly a scratch!
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: This camera was a gift for my brother and yes a great choice.I own the canon 870is and it is too a great camera.My brother is in a band and he wanted to take pictures and blow them up so me owning a canon and knowing what great cameras they are I thought the 14.7 mega pixels would be just what he would need.I would recomend this camera to any one who loves to take great pictures.Read the owners manual and learn how to really use it,you will be supprised how good a picture could turn out when the camera is on the right settings.
customer_reviews.author: Shad

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Point and Shoot
customer_reviews.text: I have had this camera for a few weeks now and am very pleased with it. It produces some of the best pictures I have seen coming from a point and shoot digital camera. It is a little large for a point and shoot, but it is still very portable and light for its size. My major complaint is the on/off button is a little more difficult to use then I think it should be. You have to press it pretty hard for it to come on, making it more difficult to quickly capture a shot. Overall, I am very happy with the camera and would recommend it to anyone looking for a higher-end point and shoot.
customer_reviews.author: techjunkie1988

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Camera
customer_reviews.text: Right to the point. I have used many point and shoot cameras over the years. Not all of them were Canon cameras. I've purchased the Canon 50D camera but wanted a smaller camera to carry around. I choose the Canon SD990 IS, 14.7 MP camera. After taking several hundred pictures with this camera I can say the picture quality is outstanding not to mention the camera's construction, also. I've taken pictures and printed them to 13" x 19" size with again, outstanding results. It's not exactly a "shirt pocket" camera but it's very easy to carry in your pocket. Purchase this camera and you will never regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Gallacher

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is very powerful for it's size. I'm always impressed with the features cannon can pack into such a small space. The only thing I'd want is to be able to add a telephoto or wide angle adaptor to the lens. For far away shots, the zoom-in isn't sufficient. For extreme wide angle shots, the zoom-out isn't sufficient.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Kierski

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera
customer_reviews.text: Probably one of the best compact camera in the market. Pictures of excellent quality. It is not a plain point a shoot camera. Manual mode allows for exposure control. Very nice and intuitive controls. I highly recommend this camera. If you do not want to carry a larger and heavier SRL, this is an excellent option.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Lopez Nunez

customer_reviews.title: my second camera of the same model!
customer_reviews.text: i love this and can't be without it. this is the second camera i bought of the same model. canon is great, the features are incredible. i really love it. i got the black so it doesn't show as much if i am taking pictures at a concert or anywhere else that is a little dark.
customer_reviews.author: Karen A. Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Awsome Camera
customer_reviews.text: 2nd Cannon Camera I've owned. Had the A95 and I have used it for years. Great upgrade. The ISO setting sees better then I do in the dark. The movie mode works great. Battery Level indicator is a nice feature. I use the camera to take pictures of my artwork for my portfolio and the lens makes everything nice and sharp. I love the size and weight. Camera's only bad flaw IMO is it's a little hard to grip with the smaller shape. Love it. Thanks Cannon.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mastri

customer_reviews.title: Canon 990IS
customer_reviews.text: I really like the look of this camera. The pictures taken were of excellent quality and crystal clear. I was glad when canon came out with a black version of the 950 IS. I think I will be happy that this may be my last camera I will need to purchase because it has all the features I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: S. Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Nice model, bad unit (I hope)
customer_reviews.text: The camera itself is really nice, seems fairly intuitive, good quality pictures, etc. but this particular one had its power button last about three weeks before it broke. Now I have to use the playback option followed by the shutter to turn it on, and I have to wait until the automatic timer turns my power off, meaning the lens doesn't retract for about 2 minutes. Not helpful when you need to pack it up and go.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: There are so many compact digital cameras on the market today that it was difficult to decide. I researched all that met my criteria and selected the Powershot SD990. I'm so glad I did. I love this camera. Picture quality, ease of use and features are superior. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Tarabird48

customer_reviews.title: A VERY GOOD CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: As ever with a Canon you have to be nervous of the infamous E18 error - but provided you don't get it you have a superb camera. It is tougher than it feels. The colours are excellent and the video makes a camcorder almost superfluous. The face recognition is a gem and I particularly like having a battery strength gauge. Batteries, let me add, seem to last and last.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: nice camera
customer_reviews.text: I found this camera to be a really nice one. However I bought it for the reason, I understood, it was great for closeups. I used the micro but was a little bit disappointed in the picture quality. I have another Canon that I use and it was better than this one. I gave this one to a friend and he loves it. He has been able to take really nice pictures and it is so easy to use. So there you have it. I would recommend buying this camera, but not for really close closeups.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: This little camera fits in a shirt pocket, but the retractable lens provides sharp photos and excellent video. The settings are very easy to control, thanks to the simple buttons on the rear and the clear display. For example, switching to macro or no-flash only takes a second. I got a USB stick with a 16 GB memory card, so I can record an hour of video. The stick transfers images and movies into my Mac without using the Canon software, and the movies are editable in iMovie.
customer_reviews.author: GWS

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: good for standard shots, not good for in school gym and zooming for pics in choir or concert.
customer_reviews.author: 2x2 make one.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect Camera, still have it since 5 years. still working perfectly. has a lot of options. love it.
customer_reviews.author: TITO Banderas

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: Lovely camera. It was a great replacement for a previous Sony digital camera. The picture quality is awesome and the special feature are fun too. I highly recommend canon cameras to anyone in the market for a digital camera.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: very nice
customer_reviews.text: a great camera, performed great in low light situations which is what i wanted it for it is a bit hard to turn on if you don't hit the button right but not a big deal shots are clear and bright very happy with this camera
customer_reviews.author: John T. Danner

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera indeed and the photos are unbelievably good. The only complaint that I have is that the camera finish is smooth and it is easy to slip out of your hand so I make sure that I put the string around my wrist
customer_reviews.author: SGS

customer_reviews.title: Sierra Hiker
customer_reviews.text: We bought this camera to replace a Canon A640. The Photos are wonderfully sharp, excellent color and contrast. It is perfect for both macro photography along with outstanding scenic shots. Nice size to slip in a pocket. We bought the Caselogic UNZ-2 Small Universal Pocket - perfect for a simple case but not room for a spear battery or extra memory card.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Brenner

customer_reviews.title: Great camera with minor drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: I have upgraded from an SD630 to the SD990is. Pros: Image stabilization - Awesome! Color quality - Excellent Video - Superb (blows away the Canon FS1000) Look - Sexy Battery: L-O-N-G life. Cons: 1) A little slow on the draw. My SD630's beats the 990is by half a second on focusing. I have some more research to do so this could be UE. 2) Size: Heavier and fatter than my SD630 but not so much so that I care. 3) Price: But that's what we have Amazon for. 4) Having to read the silly review by the dude with 16mb card comment. Come on....
customer_reviews.author: CBR

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: This Canon PowerShot does it all... I like it for its convenience without having to lug around a big dslr camera. It has image stabilization and it provides the photography enthusiast with a camera that can be used easily on auto mode or more professionally on a variety of other modes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera!
customer_reviews.text: I really like that I have the option of viewing using the screen or the peephole. No more guessing what I'm shooting when there's too much glare to see the picture on the screen. Small, light-weight, easy-to-use, yet still takes a great picture. No nasty lag time when taking the photo like some digital cameras I have used. Been using it for about a month and am more than satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Ledbetter

customer_reviews.title: Great point and shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: I love the camera! It is so easy to use and the on off button which someone said was difficult is not a problem. The battery however does not last as long as the 4 AA's I used in my last cannon so I bought an extra battery so I always have one on hand. Problem solved.. I also have a problem with the coach bag. It is too small. I feel like the zipper is going to scratch my camera screen every time I put it in so I bought a bigger camera bag. Other then that I love the photos I have taken so far. Great Quality..
customer_reviews.author: K. Zakar

customer_reviews.title: Canon is the BEST!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera b/c i was replacing my old SD550. I did about 2 days of research, and learned so much things about cameras (even things that i wont need), and this camera is by far the best out there. the first time i used it was at the Chicago auto show and the pictures were great. all the functions work perfectly and the quality is insane. my expectations were surpast.
customer_reviews.author: Ivo Bojanov

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Really love this camera. I think it is one of the best point and click cameras on the market today. I will however say the zoom on this camera isn't very good. Other than that, I love it.
customer_reviews.author: The guy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome !!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The best camera I have ever owned. This is my eighth digital camera, I have been purchasing only Canon cameras for the last four. The quality of pictures is amazing and that's not even the best part. The HD video will blow you away! Easy to use and the size is such that you can put it in your pocket and take it anywhere, never miss another photo shoot opportunity. Five star all the way.
customer_reviews.author: R. PLAZOLA

customer_reviews.title: Canon camera
customer_reviews.text: Quite a good little camera, takes great shots, versatile and shockproof.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond S. Iorio

customer_reviews.title: Excellent small camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera almost takes pictures as well as my Digital SLR. It's truly impressive. The only downside is that the body is a bit slippery and hard to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Online Shopper

customer_reviews.title: One of the best cameras in its class
customer_reviews.text: After much research I bought this camera and I couldn't be happier with my purchase. I use it almost every day and take it with me where ever I go. Excellent battery life, picture quality and features.
customer_reviews.author: MO. Bari

customer_reviews.title: I guess I was expecting a little more...
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from SD-450 to this camera. I guess my expectations were high. So, far my photos are good but not better than the 450 as far as the clarity. My biggest issue with this camera is that my photos are soft (not sharp) indoors. In good lighting, they are amazing. Also, I wish the LCD viewer was a larger. With that said, I love the face recognition with the zoom feature and "quick shot" feature that makes this camera work similar to an SLR. The video is very clear. I have only used the camera about 8 times so I will update this review upon further examination.
customer_reviews.author: CYSR

customer_reviews.title: Great point and shoot
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this camera - use it more than I use my DSLR. It's not perfect but I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot
customer_reviews.text: I got the canon powershot used & as I was used to this camera already I was disappointed the mode dial does not move as it should. However, it will do as this is not my primary camera & the price was right.
customer_reviews.author: mv

customer_reviews.title: A Winning Cannon  (Canon)
customer_reviews.text: I have had two Canon SureShots in the last couple years... both had failures (dirt on the inside, estimated to cost $175.00 to fix.) This new one with its 14.7 mgs is terrific... Great resolution. I wish it had more than a 3 to 1 zoom tho.. Love it. Easy to pocket and quick to re-bound for the next shot.
customer_reviews.author: Charles W. Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Cannon fans: first time Cannon disappointed me =(
customer_reviews.text: Extremely hard to control the quality of this camera.(or I should say very difficult to get the functions correct) Sometime I get very good quality other time I get really bad quality (NOT because I shake the camera!) eventhough I have adjust it to "auto"... seem like you have to manually adjust it to the correct scene inorder to get good quality of pictures... I got this camera for over 3 years and I still couldn't get it correct... The video quality is not good either unless you don't zoom it.
customer_reviews.author: Regular working mom

customer_reviews.title: Canon 990is review
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying learning more about the camera on an everyday basis. I do feel the camera is a bit overpriced, but overall I like the camera.
customer_reviews.author: Tasha K.

customer_reviews.title: Nearly perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is my second elph and it is the best yet. Great for social events where I don't want to bother with my DSLR. Image quality is terrific, as is the range of shooting options plus the 14.7 megapixel allows for major cropping. Would recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: D. Schuster

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: Love the ease of using this camera and the size! fits in my purse.
customer_reviews.author: Leighl293

customer_reviews.title: Canon Poweshot SD900IS
customer_reviews.text: A superb product with great results. My daughter loves it as she needed a compcat camera with good results and a good zoom.
customer_reviews.author: Muhammad Subhani

customer_reviews.title: it was great. When I bought it used
customer_reviews.text: When I bought it new, it was great. When I bought it used, it was lousy.
customer_reviews.author: Picard2006

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Camera
customer_reviews.text: I have now owned three different Canon cameras since I bought my first in 1999. My previous camera, an S60 was fantastic due to the fact that I could have more fine-grain control over my pictures than your typical point-and-shoot camera. This camera can do everything the S60 could and has a much higher resolution. I would highly recommend this to anyone who is looking for a small camera that allows for more control of over your picture-taking options, without having to buy a high-end digital SLR camera.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Ford

customer_reviews.title: Amazing deal for performance camera
customer_reviews.text: It's my first experience with Cannon in performance cams. I really was surprised regarding the quality of photos, colors and sharpness. The most amazing point for me with the image stablization. Whatever your move was or your sight move the picture comes out very stable and very sharp. I enjoy this camera very much.
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed Fares

customer_reviews.title: love my camera
customer_reviews.text: i love this camera. I have an SLR and always end up using this camera to take my pics anyway. Im about to sell my SLR and just stick with this camera. The colors that this camera catches is beautiful and vivid. ive been very happy with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Msdivinity210

customer_reviews.title: How easy to get great pictures
customer_reviews.text: Been looking for a good quality point shoot camera and I have found it in the Canon SD990IS. Got rid of my Pentax Program 35mm and very seldom even use my Minolta diamage camera anymore because it is so much easier to carry the pocket size SD990IS which takes as good pictures as my pervious cameras. Now I am seldom without my camera so when the old " I wish I had the camera " moment comes along I get the shot now. Used this for my son's recent wedding and was plesently supprised with the quality pictures and only my poor composure tecnique caused some pictures that weren't keepers.
customer_reviews.author: L. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Cannon Power shot SD9901S
customer_reviews.text: My brother bought this camera and the pictures were so great, I had to get one for myself. I love it and have taken some great pictures in the Smoky Mountains with the fall colors. Shipment was fast and a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Schoenfeld

customer_reviews.title: excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera and very easy to carry. The best review I can write is that a I have the same camera and I bought a new one for my daughter. Easy to use and as I bought the underwater case it takes wonderful underwater pictures. Great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Tricolor

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.text: The Canon Powershot SD990IS 14.7MP Digital Camera with 3.7x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom is the best little camera I've used yet. From micro pictures to large landscape shoots this Camera is the best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: Sarosh

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot SD990IS 14.7MP Digital Camera with 3.7x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom
customer_reviews.text: The Canon Powershot SD990IS 14.7MP Digital Camera with 3.7x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom is the best little camera I've used yet. From micro pictures to large landscape shoots this Camera is the best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: Garnet Ambrose

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I just sold my DSLR because I wanted something smaller but something that took great photos and this is it. The video is amazing too. I was on a job taking video and photos of a dam repair and the video I produced had amazing quality. If you are looking for a point and shoot and can afford it I would definitely recommend this one. Everyone I've shown the photos too loves it and can't believe I only paid 299!
customer_reviews.author: C. Delong

customer_reviews.title: Watch for red and yellow eye
customer_reviews.text: This camera would be great if you could take a picture of someone without the dreaded demon eye or red eye. It also does very poorly in low light. Outside it does a great job with vivid pictures that are quite impressive. If only it would work better in low light and indoors.
customer_reviews.author: wyldwrh

customer_reviews.title: Good camera
customer_reviews.text: Good camera - great pictures; I am looking for a camera that takes pictures quickly. This has that feature but you cannot use the video screen; you have to look through a tiny view finder.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle F.

customer_reviews.title: Canon camera
customer_reviews.text: Very nice camera. Great size to take anywhere. Took it to SeaWorld yesterday and it was handy and useful.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy H. Beard

customer_reviews.title: cannon powershot sd990is
customer_reviews.text: Best of all it has a view finder. Small easy to carry it around. Very simple to use yet it has many features. If you want a small camera buy it you'll love it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert P. Walck

customer_reviews.title: missing modes?
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this camera to replace an old Canon G2. I like it because it is compact and its user interface (buttons, menus, etc.) is much simpler and streamlined. And I purchased the 990 specifically because of Manual and Program modes. However, in manual mode, I have to set both the aperture and shutter speed. There does not appear to be a way to set just the aperture and let the camera automatically decide on the speed. The display shows to what degree the picture is overexposed or underexposed for a given setting, but no way to let it automatically determine the correct speed. Am I missing something?
customer_reviews.author: roger

customer_reviews.title: Totally diggin' it!
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes better pictures than the $1000+ Nikon my husband bought me 2 years ago. I bought so I could have something to throw in my purse and it has been fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jewell

customer_reviews.title: CANON POWERSHOT IS A POWERSHOT.
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING PRODUCT! I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT. I AM A PROFESSIONAL VIDEOGRAPHER AND WANTED A CAMERA THAT WAS EASY TO USE AS A POINT AND SHOOT.
customer_reviews.author: AVATAR VINCE

customer_reviews.title: 2 words
customer_reviews.text: I have only Two words that explains my review. Great Camera Great Price.....oops that was 4 words.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershpt SD990IS
customer_reviews.text: cant beat the metal body. this thing has been dropped all over the place and still works like new. picture resolution is fine especially for a little point and shoot camera.
customer_reviews.author: LRivera

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great! It takes great pictures and it has all these different features such as foliage, waterfalls, or night options that allow for taking even better pictures! I recommend this camera to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Allen Chen

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift!
customer_reviews.text: Received this product as a gift from my girlfriend, I reallt love this camera, its easy to use and the quality of the pictures are great.
customer_reviews.author: Christian P. Santos

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Who can argue with the same sensor as the G10? I'm glad I spent the extra money for this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Moe

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: This camera is very good. It takes very good pictures and has good battery life. The only downside about it is its a little bigger than i thought it would be, but overall it is a great camera
customer_reviews.author: Jason T

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot SD990IS 14.7MP Digital Camera with 3.7x Optical Image Stabilized
customer_reviews.text: Canon Powershot SD990IS 14.7MP Digital Camera with 3.7x Optical Image Stabilized GREAT CAMERA
customer_reviews.author: Carl E. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Canon Powershot SD 9901S 1407 MP
customer_reviews.text: Really good pictures. I would like more user friendly and better direction in instruction book, but great pictures make up for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanette Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: great compact camera
customer_reviews.text: I recieved my camera 2 days after ordering it using the free shipping. I am not a camera buff but it takes great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: L. Douglass

customer_reviews.title: Delievered as promised
customer_reviews.text: Great camera and the vendor delivered as promised, quick shipping, and great product. Would recommend...
customer_reviews.author: Jason Wang

customer_reviews.title: "Lens error - resart camera"
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the SD990IS from amazon on November 24th, the second day we used it the camera beeped and shutdown but the lens did not retract, now when I turn on the power the camera beeps and displays the error message. I have contacted the manufacturer and am waiting to hear back. It is rediculous that I had to call Canon on an item only a few days old. One other note, the box looked as if it had been opened and repackaged when I received it...having never had an issue with items from amazon before I decided to try it...may have been a mistake on my part, we'll see.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Brantley

customer_reviews.title: surper
customer_reviews.text: amazon price is usually cheap compared to local stores/ as always. fast and liable dealer. this prod is broght for some else to use. but just looking at it, it is somethig to satisfy most to the picturings
customer_reviews.author: N. tran

customer_reviews.title: Was delivered in defective condition
customer_reviews.text: So rather than taking a chance on getting another 990is, I returned it and Amazon's Customer service was really great about taking it back and refunding me. I would buy from Amazon again but not this particular model camera. It is not a wide angle camera and if you want wide angle don't buy this camera. Canon has other wide angle cameras. I can't comment too much on this one as it didn't work right but it was not wide angle at all.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen G. Bernard

customer_reviews.title: In perfect condition and outstanding price
customer_reviews.text: In perfect condition and outstanding price. Still my choice in compact cameras because it has a view finder for use in the sun.
customer_reviews.author: Quay

product_meta.title: Canon Powershot SD990IS 14.7MP Digital Camera with 3.7x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Black)
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackWhen you’re ready to experience a higher level of pacesetting technology and image brilliance, the PowerShot SD990 IS Digital ELPH is ready for you. One glance at the sleek sculptured profile, and you know this is a camera driven by design and features. Style without compromise is the perfect complement to the ELPH model’s most advanced feature lineup--engineering leadership that opens your eyes and imagination to the real potential and boundless pleasures of photography.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


When you’re ready to experience a higher level of pacesetting technology and image brilliance, the PowerShot SD990 IS Digital ELPH is ready for you. One glance at the sleek sculptured profile, and you know this is a camera driven by design and features. Style without compromise is the perfect complement to the ELPH model’s most advanced feature lineup--engineering leadership that opens your eyes and imagination to the real potential and boundless pleasures of photography. 

PowerShot SD990 IS Highlights 



14.7 megapixels deliver outstanding detail Powerful curves house a 14.7-megapixel Digital ELPH
The PowerShot SD990 IS Digital ELPH is all about firsts. It’s the very first ELPH to offer you the contemporary cool of pure black--making the boldest camera contours seem even more dramatic. When classic style reflects your fashion sense, indulge in the satiny glow of silver tone. Both are the very image of photography at its best, featuring megapixels that’s the highest resolution among Digital ELPH to capture every detail of the world around you. There’s never been a better time to think big, knowing that every enlargement will be sharper and more full-of-life than you’ve ever experienced before. 

3.7x optical zoom with Optical Image Stabilizer for blur-free shooting
The PowerShot SD990 IS Digital ELPH has 3.7x optical zoom. A zoom opens up a world of possibilities in your photography, and thanks to innovative Canon engineering, it’s housed in a camera that’s sized to go everywhere with you. With many cameras, hand-held shots taken at the long end of the zoom can be marred by blur. The SD990 IS Digital ELPH incorporates Canon’s exclusive Optical Image Stabilizer. The technology detects and effectively cancels camera shake, for clear, sharp images every time. 








3.7x optical zoom in action 

Optical viewfinder plus large high-quality 2.5-inch PureColor LCD II
The PowerShot SD990 IS Digital ELPH gives you large 2.5-inch LCD screen for excellent control when framing your shots. Canon’s PureColor LCD II offers spectacular color, resolution and contrast even when viewed at an angle. The screen is highly durable and easy to see in any light with a scratch-resistant, antireflective coating. It also features Night Display for easy viewing in low light--a perfect feature for gathering friends and family around to see your images. 

New DIGIC 4 Image Processor improves Face Detection, adds Servo AF, Face Detection Self-Timer and Intelligent Contrast Correction 

DIGIC 4 Image Processor
Canon’s proprietary DIGIC Image Processors have long set its cameras apart from the competition, and the new DIGIC 4 sets the bar even higher. Faster, more accurate noise reduction delivers better image quality, even at high ISO speeds. 

iSAPS Technology is an entirely original scene-recognition technology developed for digital cameras by Canon. Using an internal database of thousands of different photos, iSAPS works with the advanced DIGIC 4 Image Processor to improve focus speed and accuracy, as well as exposure and white balance. 

A new Face Self-Timer automatically detects an increase in the number of faces and makes the appropriate adjustments. For instance, to include photographer’s face in a group shot, there’s no need to rush in. Just put the camera on a stand or tripod, and specify Face Self-Timer, and the camera will wait for the photographer’s face to get on-camera before it takes the shot. Motion Detection now tracks moving subjects in a much larger range, and the new Servo AF retains focus on a moving subject after the shutter button is pressed halfway -- allowing you to wait for the perfect shot without refocusing. Also, Face Detection and Motion Detection are markedly improved. 

Intelligent Contrast Correction
DIGIC 4 also makes possible the new i-Contrast (Intelligent Contrast Correction) system, which controls the compensation level in pixel units to brighten dark areas while leaving bright areas unchanged for better images where the main subject is dark, and more natural transition. The PowerShot SD990 IS Digital ELPH can even use i-Contrast in playback mode to adjust images that were shot without the setting activated. 

Red-eye Correction provides three options for removing red-eye from subjects in flash pictures.
1) The Red-eye Correction during shooting actually identifies and corrects red-eye in human subjects as pictures are taken.
2) The SD990 IS Digital ELPH can be set to automatically detect and correct red-eye during image playback.
3) You can manually locate any red eyes in a scene during image playback on the LCD screen, and command the camera to remove them. 

Life doesn’t give you second chances to capture special times. That’s why the SD990 IS Digital ELPH features ISO 1600 and High ISO Auto settings that reduce the effects of camera shake and sharpen subjects in low-light situations, giving you greater shooting flexibility. ISO can be expanded to 3200 when you select ISO 3200 Special Scene mode. 

A Wide Range of Shooting Modes to Capture Anything
When you don’t want to control the shots, the PowerShot SD990 IS Digital ELPH offers the satisfying option of Quick shooting mode. The camera’s LCD screen turns off and the viewfinder displays the scene while framing. When the moment you want to shoot the focused moving subject comes along, this feature makes lag time shortest to capture the subject quickest. If the camera focuses on faces, the faces are also detected in the frame. 

With 21 Shooting Modes including 16 Special Scene Modes, you’re ready for whatever shot comes your way. 

Print/Share Button for easy direct printing and downloading
The PowerShot SD990 IS Digital ELPH's Print/Share button makes direct printing easier than ever. Simply connect the SD990 IS Digital ELPH to a Canon PIXMA Photo Printer or SELPHY Compact Photo Printer or any PictBridge compatible photo printer, press the lighted Print/Share button and print! Also use the Print/Share button to transfer images to a computer (Windows and Macintosh). 

Print your own ID photos in up to 28 different sizes or use the Movie Print function to output multiple stills from a recorded movie on a single sheet with a Canon SELPHY Compact Photo Printer. 

What's in the Box

 * PowerShot SD990IS Digital ELPH body 
 * Wrist Strap WS-DC7 
 * SD Memory Card SDC-32M 
 * Battery Pack NB-5L 
 * Battery Charger CB-2LX 
 * AV Cable AVC-DC400 
 * Interface Cable IFC-400PCU (USB) 
 * Solution Disk
feature_bullets: 14.7-megapixel resolution for the highest image quality
3.7x optical zoom with Optical Image Stabilizer; 2.5-inch PureColor LCD II
DIGIC 4 Image Processor improves Face Detection
Quick Mode decreases lag time so you don't miss anything
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards
